author: Special Correspondent
text:
An 18-member team of Ministers, officials and bureaucrats from Telangana were on a two-day visit to Chennai to apprise themselves of the functioning of hospitals and primary health centres.

The team was led by Telangana’s Health Minister K. Lakshmi Reddy and included secretaries and the director of medical education. The team arrived on Friday and on the first day they were taken on a trip of various hospitals in the city.

In Chennai, the team was received by a team headed by Health Minister C. Vijaya Baskar and Secretary J. Radhakrishnan, who accompanied the team on its visits to hospitals. On Saturday, the team visited the blood bank, dialysis unit and the various intensive care units and the cardiac intensive care unit of the Rajiv Gandhi Government General Hospital.
title: Telangana team visits Chennai hospitals
